vmRightsizing.title: VM Rightsizing

vmRightsizing.labelBelowChart: These insights show how well your VMs are utilised in terms of the workloads running on them, how metrics such as CPU, Memory and Virtual Disk I/O contribute to VM utilisation, and opportunities for rightsizing VMs thereby saving costs and optimising workloads.

inefficientVms.title: Inefficient VMs
inefficientVms.subTitle: A list of VMs with an efficiency index of less than 65; the higher the index, the more efficient a VM is.
inefficientVms.secondSubtitle: Efficiency index is calculated based on total VM cost compared to utilization. For example, the more a high-cost VM is utilized, the higher its efficiency index will be. See more in

security.title: Security
security.subTitle: continually assesses your resources and subscriptions for security issues. It then aggregates all the findings into a single score so you can tell, at a glance, your current security situation. The higher the score, the lower the identified risk level.

compliance.title: Compliance
compliance.subTitle: of your Azure resources and their compliance to initiatives and/or policies configured in your environment.
compliance.overAllResourceComplianceTooltip: Overall resource compliance grants an overall picture of the compliance state across all your resources for a particular subscription.
compliance.complianceStateTooltip: Resource by compliance state offers a categorized look at how many of your resources for a particular subscription fall into each compliance state.
compliance.nonCompliantInitiativesTooltip: An Azure initiative is a collection of Azure policy definitions that are grouped together towards a specific goal or purpose in mind. Any initiative which is not compliant will be counted towards this score. The total number of initiatives is based on initiatives with 1 or more matching resources.
compliance.nonCompliantPoliciesTooltip: A non-compliant policy is an Azure policy that targets a specific resource, where that resource does not conform to the regulatory or governance definitions set out in the policy. The total number of policies is based on policies with 1 or more matching resources.

resourceHealth.title: Resource Health
resourceHealth.subTitle: An unhealthy resource is a resource which has one or more identified security risks that should be mitigated. These can be addressed or exempted in the

monitoringAlerting.title: Monitoring and Alerting
monitoringAlerting.subTitle: by severity, for the specified period.

ascAlerts.title: ASC Alerts

ascAlerts.secondSubtitle: High severity ASC alerts will automatically generate a
ascAlerts.secondSubtitleContinuation: that our engineers will review for you.
ascAlerts.viewInAzurePortal: View last 3 months in Azure Portal

auditAlerts.title: Audit Alerts

updateManagement.title: Update Management

detailsStep.otherAdvisoryLabel:
By selecting 'Other', you are requesting a change or support (Azure Essentials) for a Microsoft service outside the scope of our managed services.

 To fulfil this service request, we will rely on Microsoft for advice in relation to your request and relay that advice back to you for the purpose of provisioning, configuring (Azure Managed or Essentials) or support (Azure Essentials).

serverServicesAvDetails.title: Anti-Virus
serverServicesAvDetails.description:
Server Anti-Virus provides both real-time and on-demand protection against threats such as viruses, trojans and spyware.  
The table below lists recent threat detection events and their severities (where 1 is the lowest and 6 is the highest).
serverServicesAvDetails.noContent: No threats have been identified for this server.
serverServicesAvDetails.errorContent: Sorry, something’s not right. We weren’t able to retrieve the Anti-Virus information for this server.

serverServicesHidsDetails.title: Host Intrusion Detection
serverServicesHidsDetails.description:
Host Based Intrusion Prevention rules examines payload in the session and application layers of packets (such as DNS, HTTP, SSL, and SMTP), as well as the sequence of those packets according to those higher-layer protocols.  
When traffic matches a rule or contains content that signals an attack, the Host Intrusion Detection handles it as a possible or confirmed attack, and performs the configured action.
